hackathon-description-text: BrickHack: RIT's premiere collegiate hackathon. April 18th ignites a weekend devoted to 400 designers and coders sinking 24 hours into building and creating. Mentors and industry representatives will also join the fray to lend expertise, and share wisdom. The event will span 3 floors of the GCCIS' atrium, for a multi-tiered hacking experience. Expect food, swag, and timeless brick-laden memories.
hackathon-rules:
1) All hacks must be started AFTER hacking begins.
2) Any software or hardware from a third party MUST also be publicly available to use by anybody else.
3) Do NOT steal anyone else's source code.
4) Judges make the final decision on any winner of a prize.
5) Have fun, learn something, and make something awesome!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One team will take home $200 in DigitalOcean credit and a $50 AMEX gift card (up to 3 people on a team).
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the DigitalOcean API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Spotify will be awarding the team with the best use of the Spotify API!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Spotify API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: codeRIT is giving a Bamboo Tablet to the team with the best visual design in their hack.
Twilio is giving away Phonejoy gamepads to the team who does something really awesome with the Twilio API!
codeRIT is giving away Pebbles to the team with best health-related hack!
MLH will award the team with the best use of Amazon Web Storage with free SSDs!
codeRIT is giving away LED Matricies to the team with best hardware hack!
codeRIT is giving away Spheros to the team that creates the best mobile app!
EMC will be giving out a prize to the team that showcases their innovation first.
codeRIT will be awarding the team with the best web hack Nexus 7 tablets!
Bose will be awarding the team that best leverages the SoundTouch API with Bose SoundTouch 20 speakers!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Creative Use of Bose SoundTouch API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: codeRIT's bestowing Leap Motions to the team with the best game!
Makey Makey's to best newbie hack! Newbies must be first-time hackers. Courtesy of codeRIT.
MLH is giving away Pebble Steels to the team that builds the best Pebble hack!
3 LG G watches to the best Android hack! Courtesy of Google.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Rochester Institute of Technology, 1 Lomb Memorial Drive, Rochester, NY 14623, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: What was the stack? How difficult was the project?
How well does the app run? How does the app look? How entertaining is the game?
Is the hack something new, fresh, or exciting?
Are there useful applications to the real world?

hackathon-location-address: Rochester Institute of Technology, 1 Lomb Memorial Drive, Rochester, NY 14623, USA
